description: A thrilling and thought-provoking sci-fi novel set in a dystopian future where teenagers are forced to compete in a deadly televised game of survival.

title: The Glass Castle
description: A memoir by Jeannette Walls about her unconventional upbringing with her dysfunctional family.

title: Unbroken
description: The inspiring true story of Louis Zamperini, an Olympic athlete and WWII airman who survived a plane crash and 47 days adrift at sea before being captured and sent to a Japanese POW camp.

description: A fascinating and thought-provoking biography by Rebecca Skloot about the woman whose cancer cells were used without her knowledge for scientific research and revolutionized medicine.

title: Steve Jobs
description: The definitive biography of Apple co-founder Steve Jobs, written by Walter Isaacson.

title: When Breath Becomes Air
description: A touching and profound memoir by Paul Kalanithi, a neurosurgeon diagnosed with terminal lung cancer who reflects on his life and mortality.

title: The Rise and Fall of the Third Reich
description: William Shirer's acclaimed and comprehensive account of Nazi Germany from Hitler's rise to power to his downfall.
David McCullough's fascinating and vivid account of the year 1776, a pivotal time in the American Revolution.

description: Barbara Tuchman's classic and gripping narrative of the first month of World War I, when the fate of Europe hung in the balance.

title: A People's History of the United States
description: Howard Zinn's provocative and alternative history of the United States, told from the perspective of marginalized groups and individuals.

title: The Devil in the White City
description: Erik Larson's enthralling account of the 1893 World's Fair in Chicago and the serial killer who used it as a hunting ground.

description: Isabel Wilkerson's powerful and sweeping account of the Great Migration, when millions of African Americans moved from the South to the North and West.

title: The Emperor's New Clothes: A Tale Set in China
description: Demie Chen's fascinating and beautifully illustrated retelling of the classic tale about an emperor who is tricked by his own vanity.

description: Stephen Greenblatt's captivating and revelatory history of how the rediscovery of a lost poem by Lucretius helped to spark the Renaissance.

description: Doris Kearns Goodwin's masterful and insightful account of how Lincoln assembled a team of political rivals to help him lead the nation during the Civil War.
